page.shortlink: api a5 storage save file function
page.syntax: L a5Storage_saveFile(C connectionString ,C filename ,C itemName [,C mimeType [,* pResult [,* pDataIn [,L flagSetReadPermission ]]]])

argument.name: connectionString
argument.description: Character. Storage connection string with ::storage:: as a prefix.

argument.name: filename
argument.description: Character. name of the local file to save in storage.

argument.name: itemName
argument.description: Character. name of the object in storage. You can can specify a logical folder by using forward slashes in the name. For example: image/image1.jpg

argument.name: mimeType
argument.description: Character. the mime type of the object. If you don't specify this property, the value can be inferred from the extension you assign to the itemName property.

argument.name: pResult
argument.description: * An optional dot variable that you can pass in that will be populated with information about the object.

section.description: If you examine the pr dot variable that was passed into the function you will see the following properties:
section.example: hasError = .f. timeTakenMilliseconds = 239 AbsolutePath = "https://.s3.amazonaws.com/movies/4290.jpg" ContentType = "image/jpeg" ModifiedTime = CTODT('03/15/2014 01:53:13 00 pm') Name = "movies/4290.jpg" size = 5880

section.description: The AbsolutePath property gives you a URL to the object. Note that in order for this URL to work you need to make sure that you have set the appropriate permissions on the storage container ('bucket' in S3 terminology).
